skill.name: github-pr
skill.description: GitHub PR utilities for code review workflows
skill.summary: GitHub PR utilities for code review workflows
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: This is a metadata-only skill containing documentation and configuration. No executable code exists in the directory. The skill describes tools that wrap the GitHub CLI (gh) for PR operations.

content.value_statement: Automate code review workflows with GitHub PR utilities. Check if PRs need review, find relevant guideline files, and post inline comments directly from the CLI.
actual_capabilities: Check if a pull request should be reviewed based on multiple conditions
List AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md files relevant to PR changes
Post inline comments on specific lines or line ranges in PRs
Filter out bot PRs and trivial changes from review queues
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Does not create PRs or merge them automatically
Cannot modify PR content directly without using suggestion blocks

use_cases.title: Streamline code reviews
use_cases.description: Automate PR triage by filtering out bot PRs, dependency updates, and trivial changes from review queues.

use_cases.title: Follow project guidelines
use_cases.description: Find and apply AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md guidelines when reviewing or modifying code in pull requests.

use_cases.title: Post contextual feedback
use_cases.description: Add inline code suggestions with markdown-formatted comments directly on specific lines or code blocks in PRs.

prompt_templates.title: Check PR Review Need
prompt_templates.scenario: Determine if current PR needs review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if the current pull request needs human review using check-review-needed.

prompt_templates.title: Find PR Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md files relevant to the current PR changes using list-guideline-files.

prompt_templates.title: Post Review Comment
prompt_templates.prompt: Post an inline comment on line 45 of src/auth.ts in PR #123 with the following feedback: [your feedback here]

prompt_templates.title: Full PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if PR #123 needs review, find relevant guidelines, and post inline comments for any issues found in the changes.

output: Reason: PR passes all filters - not a bot, not trivial, title indicates active work

best_practices: Install GitHub CLI and authenticate before using these tools
Use list-guideline-files to find project-specific coding standards
Include complete suggestion blocks when proposing code changes
anti_patterns: Using these tools without GitHub CLI authentication
Posting suggestions that require additional changes to work
Reviewing dependency or bot PRs when automation can skip them

faq.question: Which AI tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support this skill for PR automation workflows.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for GitHub API calls?
faq.answer: Rate limits follow GitHub API rules. Authenticated requests allow up to 5,000 calls per hour.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, run these tools in CI to automate PR triage and skip non-essential reviews automatically.

faq.question: Is my code or token data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All operations use the local gh CLI and GitHub API directly. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why does a PR show it should not be reviewed?
faq.answer: PRs are skipped if closed, merged, draft, from bots, or have only 2 or fewer lines changed.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub native reviews?
faq.answer: These tools add CLI automation for triage, guideline discovery, and scripted inline commenting.
